header.title: THE WATCHER No. 7
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Left Hand Path, Satanism

central_thesis: THE WATCHER No. 7 articulates a radical Left Hand Path philosophy, primarily from the perspective of the Order of Nine Angles (ONA), by critiquing mainstream 'New Age' and Christian movements, exposing perceived globalist 'New World Order' agendas, and advocating for an experiential, individualistic, and transgressive form of Satanism aimed at self-overcoming and the ushering in of a New Aeon. It delves into the esoteric symbolism of Baphomet within the ONA's septenary system and proposes principles for a 'Heroic Society' aligned with LHP values.

structure_content.chapter_title: IRAQ & THE NEW WORLD ORDER / 'NEW AGE' AND THE NEW WORLD ORDER
structure_content.summary: This section provides a polemical critique of contemporary geopolitical events (Gulf War) and the 'New Age' movement, arguing that both serve a globalist 'New World Order' agenda driven by plutocracy and Zionism. It frames the New Age as a symptom of civilizational decline, embodying 'herd ideologies' of 'Universal Brotherhood' and 'World Government,' which are seen as antithetical to the elitist, individualist, and aristocratic tradition of Satanism.

structure_content.chapter_title: BRAHMA KUMARIS WORLD SPIRITUAL UNIVERSITY / ALICE BAILEY'S CULTS / THEOSOPHICAL SOCIETY
structure_content.summary: These articles offer detailed analyses and critiques of specific New Age organizations (Brahma Kumaris, Alice Bailey's various cults including World Goodwill, The Triangle Centres, Lucis Trust, Arcane School, and the Theosophical Society). The analysis highlights their perceived connections to 'New World Order' ideals, their promotion of universalism, and their invocation of 'Ascended Masters' or 'Hidden Masters' as a form of 'mental subversion' leading to uniformity of opinion and the abolition of free-thought, contrasting this with the LHP's emphasis on differentiation and individual will.

This section documents an exchange of letters between a LHP practitioner and Christian academics regarding an 'Anti-Christ' text. It serves as a polemical demonstration of the LHP's intellectual challenge to conventional religious interpretations, highlighting perceived inconsistencies and a lack of 'cultural sensitivity' within Christian doctrine, while the Christian replies are largely dismissive or evasive.

This outlines a philosophical vision for a society that fundamentally recognizes and encourages inequality, seeing it as a spur for constant striving and self-overcoming. It posits excellence (athletic, intellectual, spiritual) as the ultimate goal, valorizes 'isolated intelligence,' and advocates for the elimination of repeat offenders of specific crimes and those who impose their culture/religion. The society rejects guaranteed outcomes based on birth, creed, or sex, focusing instead on individual heroic achievement and ancestral pride.

structure_content.chapter_title: HELL By Anton Long, Order of Nine Angles (England)
structure_content.summary: This foundational text by Anton Long defines 'real Satanism' as a radical, experiential path of rebellion against conformity, outlaw action, and living life to its absolute extremes. It rejects superficial displays and 'intellectual gymnastics' in favor of direct experience, advocating for transgressive acts and 'doing evil' as a means to break personal and societal restrictions, smash chains, and overcome all limits. It emphasizes personal honor and the rejection of all external authority or 'Masters'.

structure_content.chapter_title: REVIEW CHARNEL HOUSE: THE SATANICK MESSAGE by Christos Beest, Order of Nine Angles
structure_content.summary: This review describes an ONA publication that outlines a system for ushering in a 'New Aeon' through the application of 'Nietzschean Will.' The text suggests engaging with 'energies outside human conceptions of time and space,' which manifest as archetypes and gods. Practitioners ('those worthy') are encouraged to mold their unconscious mind to partake of these forces, thereby transforming themselves into 'kin of these forces' rather than 'servants of masters,' aligning with the Satanic doctrine of self-deification.

structure_content.chapter_title: BAPHOMET : A NOTE ON THE NAME From: Order of Nine Angles, Wales
structure_content.summary: This article provides a detailed esoteric analysis of Baphomet within the ONA's septenary system. Baphomet is identified as the 'Mistress of Earth,' linked to the sixth sphere (Jupiter) and the star Deneb, with her causal reflection in the third sphere (Venus) and star Antares. The text describes ancient 'sinister sacred Arcturian rites' performed every seventeen years, involving the union and sacrifice of a Priest (representing the sinister male aspect, Lucifer/Satan) with the Priestess/Mistress (Baphomet), to bring forth new energies. It corrects historical misinterpretations of Baphomet as a hermaphrodite figure, emphasizing her role as the female aspect of the dark side.

key_concepts.definition: A spiritual and philosophical path emphasizing individualism, self-deification, personal power, transgression, and the rejection of conventional morality, often in opposition to universalism and egalitarianism. It seeks inner transformation through challenging and often dark experiences.

A conspiracy theory term used in the text to describe a perceived globalist agenda, controlled by 'plutocracy and Zionism,' that manipulates geopolitical events and promotes 'moralizing slogans' to disguise covert purposes and establish a universal, homogenous society contrary to LHP principles.

Critiqued as a symptom of civilizational decline, characterized by 'alien cults' and 'herd ideologies' that promote 'Universal Brotherhood' and 'World Government.' It is seen as fostering a rootless populace unable to recognize their civilization's destiny, contrasting sharply with the LHP's focus on elitism and individualism.

A proposed societal structure where inequality is recognized as a catalyst for constant striving towards excellence (athletic, intellectual, spiritual). It values 'isolated intelligence,' rejects guaranteed outcomes based on external factors, and promotes self-overcoming and ancestral pride, advocating for severe penalties for specific societal transgressions.

As defined by Anton Long, it is a radical, experiential, and non-conformist path. It involves rebellion, outlaw behavior, living life to its limits, embracing danger and 'evil' (defined as breaking restrictions), and acquiring knowledge through direct experience rather than dogma or external authority. It rejects superficial occultism and emphasizes genuine, often challenging, transformation.

A future epoch envisioned by the ONA, to be ushered in by individuals of 'Nietzschean Will' (strong-willed, self-overcoming individuals). This involves engaging with trans-human energies, archetypes, and 'gods' through the conscious molding of the unconscious, leading to personal and collective transformation beyond current human conceptions.

Within the ONA's septenary system, Baphomet is the 'Mistress of Earth,' an esoteric entity linked to specific celestial bodies (Jupiter, Deneb, Venus, Antares). She represents the female aspect of the dark side, involved in 'sinister sacred Arcturian rites' which include the sexual union and sacrifice of a Priest (representing the sinister male aspect) to manifest new energies. This interpretation emphasizes her powerful, chthonic, and transformative role.

An esoteric framework employed by the Order of Nine Angles that maps spheres, stars, and energies to specific occult concepts and entities (e.g., Baphomet, Lucifer/Satan). It provides a structured understanding of the cosmos and its influence on ritual and aeonic magic within the ONA tradition.

A concept derived from Friedrich Nietzsche's philosophy, representing a strong, individualistic will to power and self-overcoming. In the ONA context, it refers to the inner strength and drive necessary to pursue the demanding path of Satanism, engage with sinister forces, and contribute to the ushering in of a New Aeon.

practical_system.description: The practical system outlined in THE WATCHER No. 7, particularly through the ONA and 'Heroic Society' contributions, is primarily experiential and philosophical rather than ritualistic in a traditional grimoire sense. It advocates for a life lived according to specific principles of radical individualism, self-overcoming, and transgression. The core practice involves 'doing evil' to break personal and societal restrictions, pushing one's limits through real-world challenges, and engaging with sinister forces directly. This lived experience, guided by 'Nietzschean Will,' is intended to foster personal transformation and contribute to the ushering in of a 'New Aeon.' Esoteric knowledge, such as the septenary system and the symbolism of Baphomet, provides a theoretical framework for understanding and interacting with these forces.
tools: Nietzschean Will (inner strength and drive for self-overcoming)
Lived experience and transgressive acts (means of breaking restrictions and gaining gnosis)
Molding the unconscious (a technique for engaging with archetypes and energies for transformation)
Knowledge of the Septenary System (esoteric framework for celestial and energetic alignments)
Swords, staffs, censers, talismans, robes, beeswax candles (general occult paraphernalia, advertised rather than detailed in ONA system)
rituals: Sinister sacred Arcturian rite (ONA): A recurring rite (every 17 years) involving a union between a Priestess/Mistress (Baphomet) and a Priest (sinister male aspect), followed by the Priest's sacrifice after sexual union, aligned with the rising of Arcturus to manifest new energies.
Black Mass (mentioned as an activity of 'THE ORDER OF THE SWORD OF DAMOCLES'): A general LHP ritual, though specific ONA details are not provided within the core philosophical articles.

relevant_quotes.text: The concept is quite contrary to the elitist, individualist and aristocratic tradition of Satanism. Indeed it is classifiable as one of what Nietzsche called the herd ideologies and religions, a part of the revolt of the Under-Man against all that is noble and superior;

The 'spiritual energy' sent out by the World Servers will be transformed into 'thought energy', impacting upon the collective psyche of mankind; a kind of spooky mass brainwashing - mental subversion - which presumably is intended to lead to uniformity of opinion and the abolition of free-thought, the cherished aim of all internationalists, from the Bolshevik commissar to the UN bureaucrat.
In an Heroic Society inequality is recognized as a fact -- not to bring about stagnation but to encourage a constant striving on the part of all.

I shall be honest - Satanism has been hijacked. By posers, by pseudo-intellectuals and by gutless weaklings who like the glamour and danger associated with it in the public mind but who do not have the guts to be evil - to do dark deeds.

What, then, is real Satanism all about? First, it is about rebellion - against the conformity of the present. And I mean a real rebel, a real outlaw someone who cuts a dash, who has charisma, whose very presence makes others uneasy (and who does not have to wear some stupid 'costume' to do this).
What is evil? All that restricts life - all that tries to constrain the possibilities. Doing evil means breaking these restrictions and constraints - and taking the consequences of your actions.
The message is directed to those of Nietzschean Will, who have the strength to usher in a New Aeon which certain energies outside th human conceptions of time and space await.
In the septenary system Baphomet, as Mistress of Earth, is linked to the sixth sphere (Jupiter) and the star Deneb. She is thus in one sense a magickal 'Earth Gate'...
According to tradition, the Priest was sacrificed after the sexual union, where the role of Baphomet was assumed by the Priestess/Mistress of the cult.

critical_analysis.relevance: THE WATCHER No. 7 is highly relevant for understanding the evolution of the Left Hand Path in the late 20th century. It provides a unique, direct insight into the polemical and philosophical foundations of radical Satanic groups like the Order of Nine Angles, predating much of its later public notoriety. The detailed esoteric analysis of Baphomet and the exposition of the ONA's concept of a 'New Aeon' and 'real Satanism' are significant technical contributions to occult scholarship. The document acts as a primary source for the early articulation of these complex, often controversial, systems, offering a counter-narrative to mainstream occultism and contemporary 'New Age' spiritualities.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The document's target audience is primarily individuals within or aspiring to the Left Hand Path, particularly those drawn to radical Satanic and anti-establishment philosophies. It appeals to practitioners interested in advanced occult theory, aeonic magic, and a deep, experiential, and challenging form of spiritual development. The polemical tone and internal critiques also suggest an audience concerned with defining and purifying the LHP tradition against perceived dilutions or external influences, requiring a certain level of commitment and understanding of esoteric and philosophical concepts.
